summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 between attorneys and federal investigators regarding the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. It discusses scheduling meetings with a key witness (referred to as 'Ms. pup'), planning to contact her family members and other potential witnesses, and mentions the filing of a civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle representing a witness ('Ms. pup') in the SDNY investigation. He coordinates meetings and witness contact permissions with federal investigators.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle copied on emails regarding the SDNY investigation and witness coordination.

persons.name: Howie Simon
persons.context: Identified by the witness as a contact that federal investigators sought permission to reach out to.

persons.name: Dr. Cabe
persons.context: Identified by the witness as a contact that federal investigators sought permission to reach out to.

persons.name: John Larkin
persons.context: Identified by the witness as a contact that federal investigators sought permission to reach out to.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with investigators seeking to discuss specific conduct by him.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to alongside Epstein as a subject of the SDNY investigation, with investigators seeking to discuss specific conduct.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at the law firm Panish Shea & Boyle, working on the same case.
Glassman is the attorney representing the witness referred to as 'Ms. pup' in the SDNY investigation.
Investigators are conducting interviews and seeking information from the witness about Epstein and Maxwell.
Both are named together as subjects of the SDNY investigation regarding specific conduct.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filing Noted
events.description: Based on media reports, a civil lawsuit related to the investigation appears to have been filed. Investigators request a copy.

events.title: Witness Meeting Scheduled
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for Monday, December 16, 2019, at 11:00 a.m. at Robert Glassman's office between the witness, her attorneys, and federal investigators.

events.title: Permission to Contact Witness Network
events.description: Federal investigators received permission from attorney Robert Glassman to begin contacting individuals identified by the witness, including her siblings, mother, Howie Simon, Dr. Cabe, and John Larkin.

keyFacts: Federal investigators from the SDNY were actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein and Maxwell as of late 2019/early 2020, coordinating with a key witness's attorneys.

A witness (referred to as 'Ms. pup') had identified several potential contacts for investigators, including family members (siblings, mother) and individuals named Howie Simon, Dr. Cabe, and John Larkin.
The witness's mother was overseas and considered a potentially key witness, but investigators agreed not to contact her until after speaking with the witness and her attorney.
A civil lawsuit related to the case was reported filed in January 2020, prompting investigators to request a copy from the witness's attorney.
Meetings between the witness, her attorneys (Robert Glassman, Nathan Werksman), and investigators were being scheduled in California, indicating the witness was located there.
